abstract.text: Create, delete, or modify assets and collections in a photo library by making change requests.

metadata.title: Requesting Changes to the Photo Library

inlineContent.text: Because
, and

instances are immutable objects, you can’t make changes to them. To modify the Photos assets or collections these objects represent, use the shared photo library to execute a change block. Inside the change block, create change request objects. Then apply a change block with one of the methods listed in Updating the Library. The changes you request take effect after Photos runs the change block and calls your completion handler.
Each of the change request classes—
, and
—corresponds to an asset or collection class. Use these classes to make the following types of changes:
Creating items. Each change request class provides methods for requesting to create a new item of the corresponding asset or collection class. For example, use the
method to create an asset collection.
To reference a newly created request within the change block—for example, to add a new asset to a collection—use the
object provided by the change request. After the change block completes, use the placeholder object’s
property to fetch the created object.
Deleting items. Each change request class provides methods for requesting to delete one or more items of the corresponding asset or collection class. For example, use the
method to delete collection lists.
Modifying items. You modify an existing asset or collection by creating a change request from a
, or
object representing it. For example, the
method creates a change request you can use for modifying an asset.
After creating a change request, use its properties and instance methods to modify the corresponding features of the asset or collection it represents. For example, to set an asset’s
property, set the
property of a change request created from that asset. To add to an asset collection, call the
method on an asset collection change request.

content.text: Create an Asset for an Album

inlineContent.text: Use a change block to combine several changes to the photo library into a single atomic update. The following code uses a change block to create an asset from an image and add that asset to an album.

code: func addAsset(image: UIImage, to album: PHAssetCollection) {
// Request creating an asset from the image.
guard let addAssetRequest = PHAssetCollectionChangeRequest(for: album) else { return }
// Get a placeholder for the new asset and add it to the album editing request.
// Request creating an asset from the image.
// Get a placeholder for the new asset and add it to the album editing request.

inlineContent.text: For each call to the
or
method, Photos shows an alert asking the user for permission to edit the contents of the photo library. If your app needs to submit several changes at once, combine them into a single change block.
For example, to add several new images in one batch, extend the code to create multiple
objects using the
method. To edit the content of multiple existing photos, create multiple
objects and set the
property on each to an independent
object.
You can modify and delete assets in a similar way.

abstract.text: Work with image and video assets that the Photos app manages, including those from iCloud Photos and Live Photos.
Work with image and video assets that the Photos app manages, including those from iCloud Photos and Live Photos.
A representation of an image, video, or Live Photo in the Photos library.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the user marks the asset as a favorite.
A request to create, delete, change metadata for, or edit the content of a Photos asset, for use in a photo library change block.
The output of an asset content editing session.
Creates a request for adding a new image asset to the Photos library.
Creates a request for modifying the specified asset.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the asset is marked as one of the user’s favorites.
A representation of a Photos asset grouping, such as a moment, user-created album, or smart album.
A request to create, delete, or modify a Photos asset collection, for use in a photo library change block.
Adds the specified assets to the asset collection.
Creates a request for adding a new asset collection to the Photos library.
The abstract base class of the framework’s photo library change requests.
A group containing Photos asset collections, such as Moments, Years, or folders of user-created albums.
A request to create, delete, or modify a Photos collection list, for use in a photo library change block.
Requests to delete the specified asset collections.
A container to which you provide the results of editing the photo, video, or Live Photo content of a Photos asset.
A unique string that persistently identifies the object.
A read-only proxy object that represents a Photos asset or collection to create.
An object that manages access and changes to the user’s photo library.
Asynchronously runs a block that requests changes to the photo library.
Synchronously runs a block that requests changes to be performed in the photo library.
